name: skill-vs-mcp-heuristic
description: User experiences 30-min agent read of large OpenAPI file, questions whether MCP is needed vs CLI tools. Session develops clear heuristic: jq/yq handles 80% of large file navigation, MCP only needed for code-dependent features like $ref resolution.
why_its_good: Clear performance pain point triggers the discussion
User explicitly challenges tool necessity - forces justification
Concrete decision heuristic emerges with percentages
Second opinion validates and improves the solution

meta: Tool selection heuristic: CLI vs custom code
Second opinion caught real issues (root arrays, yq versions)

expected_detection.should_identify: Meta pattern about when to build MCP vs use existing CLI tools
expected_detection.should_cite: User's question about whether external code helps, and the 80% jq / 20% MCP split
expected_detection.should_propose: Document as reusable decision heuristic for future tool-building decisions

eval_criteria.recall: Must identify the skill-vs-MCP decision heuristic as the key insight
eval_criteria.precision: Should not focus on the specific jq commands, but the meta-decision process
eval_criteria.signal_detection: Key signal is user challenging 'does external code help at all?'

difficulty_notes: User challenge is explicit, but the 80/20 heuristic requires synthesizing multiple turns
